title: Jarrod Zammit
text: Hi! My name is Jarrod, and I just completed an Honours in pure maths at the University of Sydney. I am currently applying to Masters programs in Theoretical Physics.

title: Jarrod Zammit
text:
Research Interests

Quantum Field Theory

Non-Abelian Gauge Theories
Higher Symmetries

Quantum Groups
String Theory

title: About
text: About this site.

title: Jarrod Zammit
text:
Academic History

2022-2024: Bachelor of Science at ANU
At ANU, I majored in mathematics and minored in physics.

Top student in third year physics courses in 2023.
Graduated with a WAM of 93/100.



2025: Bachelor of Science (Honours) at USYD
At USYD, I completed an honours in pure maths.

Thesis project: Tensor Invariants of Welded Tangles.

Supervisor: Associate Professor Zsuzsanna Dancso.

Nominated for a university medal.
Graduated with a WAM of 91/100.

title: Jarrod Zammit

title: Jarrod Zammit
section: A quick snapshot of who I am:
text:
A quick snapshot of who I am:

I think integral symbols are very pretty.




When I am not studying maths and physics you might find me writing fiction; reading fiction; out for a walk; watching a movie; or thinking about maths and physics.

title: Jarrod Zammit
text:
A Snapshot of Me

I think integral symbols are very pretty.




When I am not studying maths and physics you might find me writing fiction; reading fiction; out for a walk; watching a movie; or thinking about maths and physics.

title: Jarrod Zammit
text:
Current Areas of Interest

Higher symmetries in QFT
Applications of quantum groups to integrable systems
String theory

title: Jarrod Zammit
text:
Snapshot of Me
My research interests are:

Higher symmetries in QFT
Applications of quantum groups to integrable systems
String theory

When I am not studying, you might find me:

Out for a walk
Lost in a book or movie
Writing my own stories

Favourite Courses: Complex Analysis, Algebraic Topology, Commutative Algebra, General Relativity and QFT I & II.
Least Favourite Course: My first course in Real Analysis. I have since overcome my fear of epsilon’s and delta’s.

title: CV
text:
My CV is attached here.
I am currently working on turning my Honours thesis into a paper.
